means: 人民党主义，旧俄民粹主义

sentence.Network_en: But some of his policies carry a whiff of populism.
sentence.Network_cn: 但他的政策也带着一点民粹主义.

sentence.Network_en: The fires of populism are burning ever more brightly.
sentence.Network_cn: 民粹主义的火焰越烧越旺.

sentence.Network_en: On economics, too, the Edwards brand of populism is hard to pigeonhole.
sentence.Network_cn: 在经济方面, 爱德华兹品牌的平民主义也没有多大特色.

entry.tran: （以平民利益和主张为诉求的）平民主义，民粹主义
entry.def: Populism refers to political activities or ideas that claim to promote the interests and opinions of ordinary people.

example.ex: ...an artful blend of Russian nationalism and economic populism.
example.tran: 俄罗斯民族主义和经济民粹主义的巧妙融合

means.word_mean: 1. the political doctrine that supports the rights and powers of the common people in their struggle with the privileged elite

auth_sentence.content: Democracy and populism seem to have become hopelessly confused.
auth_sentence.res_content: Democracy and populism seem to have become hopelessly confused.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Democracy and populism seem to have become hopelessly confused.

auth_sentence.content: Fiscal populism, however, is another story.

auth_sentence.content: There is no need for populism any longer.
